Title: Koutsuu Anzen de Gozaru Ninja Hattori-kun
Japanese: 交通安全でござる忍者ハットリくん
Synopsis: A traffic safety anime starring the cast of Ninja Hattori-kun.

Title: Higuma no Ongaeshi
Japanese: ひぐまのおんがえし
Synopsis: A traffic safety film with forest animals. A bear father takes his bear son into the mountains to improve his health with the fresh air. His father tells him about traffic rules and how many forest animals get hurt when they don't follow them.

Title: Ganbare! Ko Zou no Koutsuu Anzen Patrol-tai
Japanese: がんばれ！子象の交通安全パトロール隊
Synopsis: A children's traffic safety education anime with animal policemen.

Title: Kyonshii Kyonta no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: キョンシーキョン太の交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring a kyonshii, known as a Chinese hopping vampire/zombie (natively called jianshi in Chinese but kyonshii in Japan). Kyonshii horror films were popular in the late 80s.

Title: Koala-chan no Shouboutai
Japanese: コアラちゃんの消防隊
Synopsis: Koala and other animal firefighters teach fire safety.

Title: 0-sen Hayato Pilot
Japanese: 0戦はやと 奇襲
Synopsis: The pilot episode of 0-sen Hayato released only on VHS and Betamax. Chronologically it is considered the 1st episode of the franchise.

Title: Okaasan no Ki
Japanese: おかあさんの木
Synopsis:
Based on a book by Okawa Etsuo.

In 1937 a mother with 7 children has to see her eldest three sons go off to war. She plants Paulownia tree seeds and prays to the trees every day for her sons to come back safely.

Title: Kyouiku Eiga-sai Jushou Anime Series
Japanese: 教育映画祭受賞アニメシリーズ
Synopsis: Educational Film Festival winning anime series. Some are original stories, some are adaptations of famous short stories; both are meant to pull at your heart-strings.

Title: Peter-kun no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: ピーターくんの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety film revolving around a little boy and an alien who came down in a fireball. The alien saved the little boy from being run over by a car.

Title: Chiisana Penguin Lolo no Bouken
Japanese: 小さなペンギンロロの冒険
English: The Adventures of Scamper the Penguin
Synopsis:
Lolo is a penguin who loves to explore. With his friend Pepe, he has wonderful adventures. They discover together the wonders of their world from a puppy called Don and his owner a scientist who is studying the Antarctic environment. They also discover that not everything in their world is friendly when they get stranded far from home. Yet with luck and the brave Lolo in the lead, anything can happen.

(Source: ANN)
Genres: Adventure, Drama, Fantasy, Slice of Life

Title: Seimei no Kagaku: Micro Patrol
Japanese: 生命の科学ミクロパトロール
Synopsis:
The series "Once Upon a Time... Life" teaches about the human body and about the different systems in it with the same characters from the other "Once Upon a Time" seasons. "The good Characters" represent the body's defense mechanisms, whereas "the bad Characters" represent the viruses and bacteria that threaten to attack the human body.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Title: Choujuu Kishin Dancougar: Juusenki-tai Songs
Japanese: 超獣機神ダンクーガ SONG SPECIAL 獣戦機隊SONGS
Synopsis: A lengthy tribute music video featuring various songs.

Title: Kakusenou Gakushuu Animation
Japanese: 核戦争 学習アニメーション
Synopsis: An educational anime about nuclear war.

Title: Umi no Koumori
Japanese: 海のコウモリ
Synopsis: An educational film teaching the concept of "innocent till proven guilty".

Title: Maple Town no Shouboutai
Japanese: メイプルタウンの消防隊
Synopsis: A fire safety video starring the cast of Maple Town Monogatari.

Title: Touch: Tobidashi wa Out Da yo!
Japanese: タッチ とびだしはアウトだよ
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Touch.

Title: Kaminari Boy Pikatta-kun no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: カミナリ坊やピカッ太君の交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety anime starring the cast of Kaminari Boy Pikkari★bee.

Title: Bero-dashi Chonma
Japanese: ベロ出しチョンマ
Synopsis:
Based on a novel by Ryusuke Saito.

An educational film about oppressed farmers in the Edo period who tried to better themselves only to get crucified.

Title: Captain Tsubasa no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: キャプテン翼の交通安全
Synopsis: An education film for children starring the Captain Tsubasa cast, it teaches traffic safety specifically around playing near streets.

Title: Tokyo Dai Kuushuu: Aoyo, Kaette Koi
Japanese: 東京大空襲 あおよかえってこい
Synopsis: A stop-motion puppet animation about the Operation Meetinghouse air raid on Tokyo which caused over 100,000 deaths.

Title: Maple Town no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: メイプルタウンの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety video starring the cast of Maple Town Monogatari.

Title: Habatake Pii-tan
Japanese: 羽ばたけピータン
Synopsis: A fire safety anime directed by Tsutomu Shibayama.

Title: Ningen no Uta
Japanese: にんげんの詩
Synopsis: For the first time, 18 year old Mitsuko is facing discrimination as she tries to pursue a career.

Title: Sekai Jinken Sengen
Japanese: 世界人権宣言
Synopsis: A commissioned anime by the Japanese branch of Amnesty International. In it they explain 30 terms used in human rights in an easy to explain manner.

Title: Peter-kun no Hinotama Taiji
Japanese: ピーター君の火の玉たいじ
Synopsis: A fire safety film revolving around a little boy, an alien who came down in a fireball, and a house fire accidentally caused by a house keeper.

Title: Li'l Chillun'
Japanese: リルチルン
Synopsis: Li'l Chillun' is a curious snow child who loves to bring happiness to others. It's Christmas Eve and houses in the village leave out presents for Li'l Chillun' as a thank you.

Title: Super Mario no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: スーパー マリオの交通安全
Synopsis:
A young boy and his little sister are playing Super Mario Bros. 3 on their Famicom, when their mother calls and tells them to come to her shop, however, by the time she is finished at work some time has gone by and the young boy is still playing Super Mario Bros. 3. His little sister gets impatient and leaves without him. She is too young to know where the shop is and she gets lost. The boy then runs off to look for his lost sister and almost gets hit by a driver, which was Mario. He gets out and gives him a small lecture on being safe when crossing the road.

(Source: Super Mario Wiki)

Title: Kaminari Boy Pikatta-kun no Jitensha Kyoushitsu
Japanese: カミナリ坊やピカッ太君の自転車教室
Synopsis: A bicycle safety anime starring the cast of Kaminari Boy Pikkari★bee.

Title: Jack to Mame no Ki (OVA)
Japanese: ジャックと豆の木
Synopsis:
A little-known adaptation of "Jack and the Beanstalk," directed by Morimoto Kouji and produced at Studio 4°C in 1989 for the collection "Anime Video Art Collection," a series of animated shorts based on stories for children. Released only on VHS.

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Inamura no Hi (1989)
Japanese: 稲むらの火
Synopsis: Tells the real story about the 1854 Nankai earthquake and subsequent tsunami. 5 samurai villagemen tried to warn villages to evacuate after seeing the tsunami in the distance and it fell mostly on deaf ears. They then set fire to threshed rice in order to have the villagers run up to the fields in order to put out the fire thinking the whole crop is on fire. The plan worked and almost every village member ran up as the rice crops were their only livelihood. The tsunami came and the whole villages below were destroyed thus saving the villagers from death.

Title: Hulu Xiao Jin Gang
Japanese: 葫芦小金刚
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Minna no Taabou Konnichiwa
Japanese: みんなのたぁ坊こんにちは
Synopsis: Taabou travels around saying "hello" to everyone.

Title: Mirai Kara no Message
Japanese: 未来からのメッセージ
Synopsis: An educational film about adoption discrimination in Japan. How those who are adopted are seen as rejects of society and the public koseki allows for companies to see the family tree of applicants and not hire/fire employees based on the fact that they're adopted.

Title: Gakushuu Animation Nihon Koku Kenpou
Japanese: 学習アニメーション日本国憲法
Synopsis: An educational film about the formation of the Constitution of Japan.

Title: Wansa-kun OVA
Japanese: ワンサくん
Synopsis:
Compilation OVA of the Wansa-kun series.

Reminiscent of Disney's Lady and the Tramp, this work depicts the friendship between Wansa, who looks for his mother, and his friends. 

Wansa-kun was originally developed as the mascot character for the Sanwa Bank. The character was used for the TV series, and Tezuka Osamu was credited only as the writer of the original story.

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Shin-chan ga Naita!
Japanese: 新ちゃんがないた！
Synopsis: An educational film about living with disabilities in Japan.

Title: Super Mario no Shouboutai
Japanese: スーパーマリオの消防隊
Synopsis:
An obscure anime video animated by Toei that also functions as a fire safety Public Service Announcement. Very little is known about the video and details regarding distribution, plot and character names can only be deduced by the video itself.

(Source: MarioWiki)

Title: Taabou no Ganbaru Sengen
Japanese: たあ坊のガンバル宣言
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Futari no Tarou
Japanese: ふたりのタロウ
Synopsis: A modern boy Tarou timeslips into the Edo period and experiences the severity of the caste system.

Title: Ponta-kun no Otegara
Japanese: ポンタくんのおてがら
Synopsis: An educational children's anime about abduction awareness. A wolf kidnaps Mimiko the rabbit from a nearby park and Ponta the tanuki helps save her.

Title: Fire Robo 119 tai Kyonshii Kyonta
Japanese: ファイヤーロボ119対キョンシーキョン太
Synopsis: An educational children's film about fire safety starring Fire Robot 119, a cyborg fireman. He fights a kyonshii, known as a Chinese hopping vampire/zombie (natively called jianshi in Chinese but kyonshii in Japan). Kyonshii horror films were popular in the late 80s.

Title: Kaitei-koku no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: 海底国の交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety anime by Toei that uses components of the folktale Urashima Tarou woven into an underwater city with submarines instead of cars.

Title: Ultraman Kids no Shouboutai
Japanese: ウルトラマンキッズの消防隊
Synopsis: A fire safety film starring the Ultraman Kids cast.

Title: Kizuna: Ningen no Uta Part 2
Japanese: きずな ～にんげんの詩パート２～
Synopsis: An educational film about marriage discrimination; how hard it is for a lower class person to marry into upper class.

Title: Hana Ichi Monme (OVA)
Japanese: はないちもんめ
Synopsis:
Animated versions of tales that won the Short Story Prize in the Hanaichi Monme bulletin, including Noboru and the Wildcat, The Misleading Friends, Sanma 's March, Red Mail-Box on the Mountain-Tot), and One Sunday Morning at the Beginning of May.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

Title: Anime Hachiko Monogatari
Japanese: アニメ ハチ公物語
Synopsis: An biography of Hachikou, a real Japanese dog who was remembered for its extreme loyalty to his owner even after the owner's death.

Title: Niji no Kakehashi
Japanese: 虹のかけ橋
Synopsis: Satoshi is a popular boy thanks to his success in soccer. Kaori becomes jealous and spreads rumors that Satoshi was of low class birth. The school begins to shun Satoshi to the point that he stops playing soccer. When Kaori's house is damaged by a landslide Satoshi comes to help.

Title: Yuuki Aru Hotaru to Tobe Nai Hotaru
Japanese: 勇気あるホタルととべないホタル
Synopsis:
It is a summer night. From the "firefly inn" on the banks of the stream, as the grown fireflies danced, they flew to the night sky one after another.

But only one remains still. It could not fly because the wings were deformed at birth.

Fellow fireflies narrowed their wisdom and succeeded in having it climb up the branches of the willow. The view from the top of a tall tree, it was lovely. But, there was danger waiting.

A good older sister and brother came to pick fireflies and tried to catch the disabled firefly. "Dangerous!" Having a firefly that can not move to save itself, a brave firefly jumped into the hand of a boy as a self-sacrifice.

But, they were kind-hearted children. They came to get fireflies for their sister who was unable to walk because of a lame foot. In the room where the light was turned off, fireflies shined brightly. This day, fireflies and the hearts of the children were in unison and spoke with each other.

"Fireflies, come and see me again" said the little disabled sister. From the children's window, they saw the hordes of fireflies that came lit up shining like an aurora.

Title: Nihon no Otogibanashi
Japanese: 日本のおとぎばなし
Synopsis: Various classic Japanese fairy tales told for child aged audiences.

Title: Christmas Carol
Japanese: クリスマスキャロル
Synopsis: An anime adaptation of Charles Dickens' A Christmas Carol.

Title: Juuroku Jizou Monogatari: Sensou no Gisei ni Natta Kodomo-tachi
Japanese: 十六地蔵物語 ―戦争の犠牲になった子どもたち―
Synopsis: 1 day before the end of WWII for Japan in September 1944 Sadamitsu, Tokushima was under one final air raid. Elementary school boys proceeded to carry out their evacuation policy and many became victims.

Title: Ticonderonga no Iru Umi
Japanese: タイコンデロンガのいる海
Synopsis:
Based on a children's picture book of the same name.

On December 5, 1965, a U.S. aircraft carrier is en route from Vietnam to Yokosuka, Japan. While conducting training exercises 80 miles off Okinawa, an A4 strike aircraft is loaded with a B43 hydrogen bomb, but it falls overboard and sinks in 16,000 feet of water. Based on the true story of the USS Ticonderoga, which reached Japan two days later (on the anniversary of Pearl Harbor; nice touch). Neither side revealed the incident, nor that she was carrying atomic weapons in contravention of U.S. treaties with Japan. The plane, its pilot, and the bomb were never recovered, and the incident was only declassified in 1989, causing an outcry in Japan and resulting in this environmentally themed anime. The extra "n" in Ticonderonga may be a genuine error in transcription or an attempt to distance the story from real events, since the anime continues with Ashika, a boy from a Japanese fishing town, contacted by telepathic whales who bring him visions of fearful seamonsters. Then again, if you were a whale given a choice between nuclear contamination and talking to Japanese fishermen, which would you choose?

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

Title: Hitotsu no Hana
Japanese: 一つの花
Synopsis:
Based on a book of the same name.

An educational film about the food shortage during the Pacific War.

Title: UFO Nitsukamatta Kodomo-tachi
Japanese: UFOにつかまった子供たち
Synopsis:
Educational video that teaches kids about the value of money and the consequences of overconsumption.

*Part of the series of films produced with cooperation of: Japan's Central Council for Financial Services Information and Bank of Japan Public Relations Department.

Title: Ken-chan to Bouen Kazoku
Japanese: ケンちゃんと防炎家族
Synopsis: A film about the importance of fireproof products in the household.

Title: Hello Kitty no Fushigi na Mizuumi
Japanese: ハローキティのキティのふしぎなみずうみ
Synopsis: Kitty and Mimmy hear about the mysteries of a lake when they go up to fish with their Papa. At night they discover a Loch Ness monster like creature and fairy. The monster does not want to live in the lake anime due to illegal dumping which is also causing the fish to leave. The girls recruit a grandmother witch to help the monster gain the ability of flight so it can leave. But it asks the witch to also clear the lake of debris too. Now it can live happily in its lake.

Title: Super Mario World: Mario to Yoshi no Bouken Land
Japanese: スーパーマリオワールド マリオとヨッシーの冒険ランド
Synopsis:
Super Mario World: Mario to Yoshi no Bouken Land is an interactive anime video based on the game Super Mario World. It is designed for use with Bandai's Terebikko system, which utilizes a telephone-shaped microphone to "interact" with the video. It asks the viewer multiple choice questions, such as what will hatch from Yoshi's egg.

(Source: Mario Wiki)

Title: Hai! Akko Desu: Minna no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: ハーイあっこです-みんなの交通安全-
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Hai! Akko Desu.

Title: AEIOUdan: Douro no Tadashii Watari Kata
Japanese: あいうえおうだん－どうろのただしいわたりかた
Synopsis: A Toyota Motor commissioned work for children aged 3-5, so that they could learn about traffic safety. The title is a fusion of the English vowels AEIOU and the Japanese word for crossing (oudan) the road.

Title: Tamagawa Kyoudai
Japanese: 玉川兄弟
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Tong Tong - You You no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: トントン・ユウユウの交通安全
Synopsis:
Tong Tong (based on a real panda at Ueno Zoo of the same name who became the first giant panda to successfully be birthed in captivity Japan) and You You (Tong Tong's male sibling born 2 years after her) decide to go out of the house and into the city without their parents to meet their friend Mori (who is with his dad). They end up learning traffic safety from a helpful police woman who gets them to their destination safely. 

This educational short was in part made in honor of the 20th anniversary of the "Normalization of the Sino-Japanese Relations" (1972) where pandas were temporarily exchanged.

Title: Chouetsu Sekai
Japanese: 超越世界
Synopsis:
Aum Shinrikyou is a Japanese doomsday cult founded by Shoko Asahara in 1984. It carried out the deadly Tokyo subway sarin attack in 1995 and was found to have been responsible for another smaller sarin attack the previous year.

The cult created its own studio called MAT (Manga, Animation, and Team) in 1991 for the sole purpose of recruiting otaku into their cult. This 10 episode OVA mostly focuses around Asahara himself being Christ. All 10 episodes were sold separately during its initial release but a compilation is available on the cult's official YouTube channel.

Title: Crayon no Hoshi
Japanese: クレヨンの星
Synopsis: An educational film about a teamwork. A group of crayons get a message that they can meet with the a king star if they have great values. Bickering ensues and they have to work together to prove their worth to meet the king.

Title: Kobo-chan no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: コボちゃんの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Kobo-chan. The kids almost get run over by a truck when joyfully jumping into the road after catching tadpoles.

Title: Takarajima Memorial: Yuunagi to Yobareta Otoko
Japanese: 宝島メモリアル「夕凪と呼ばれた男」
Synopsis: A short story during Jim's adventure at sea. He encounters a man at a bar who told a tail about a one-legged man. Thinking it's Silver who the man is referring too, Jim later asked him for details. The man told Jim that, near the coast Maratoran, Silver left the ship they were on  went to the island on a small boat. Jim, who couldn't go at the time, left for Maratoran six years later. He met Silver's wife and son there.

Title: Hoshigari Hime no Bouken
Japanese: ホシガリ姫の冒険
Synopsis:
A fairy-tale telling the story of a wealthy, spoiled princess Katharine who got changed into "normal" girl by a Witch and now have to live among common village folks adapting to their modest lifestyle.

*Part of the series of films produced with cooperation of: Japan's Central Council for Financial Services Information and Bank of Japan Public Relations Department.

Title: Hare Tokidoki Buta: Noriyasu-kun no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: はれときどきぶた のりやすくんの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety video starring the cast of Hare Tokidoki Buta. This version uses the film's art style and character personalities.

Title: Shounen Ashibe Anzen Kyouiku Anime
Japanese: 少年アシベ 安全教育アニメ
Synopsis: A pair of educational films about emergency protocols and traffic safety, respectively.

Title: Sekai no Hikari: Shinran Shounin
Japanese: 世界の光 親鸞聖人
Synopsis:
Young Matsuwakamaru loses his father as an infant. To make matters worse, his beloved mother Kikkou passes away when he's 8 years old. While facing her death, Matsuwakamaru is puzzled at where people go when they die. If there is a cycle of heaven, hell, and rebirth, is there a way to escape this torturous circle, he wonders. With this great determination for the discovery of knowledge in mind, at only 9 years old, he joins a Buddhist monastery on Mt. Hiei, and changes his name to Shinran. This is the story of the man who would someday open the doors to the Joudo Shinshuu sect of Buddhism.

(Source: ANN)

Title: Two on the Road: Itsumo Futari de
Japanese: TWO ON THE ROAD「いつもふたりで」
Synopsis:
Two anthology releases of 13 short stories, based on originals by Seizo Watase. As with other adaptations of Watase's work, they are set to music-stories here include: Ashes of Love, White Fish/Blue Fish, Dance on the Sands, Glider, Handbag Mirror, Blue Snow, Living in the World, etc.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

Title: Mina no Egao
Japanese: ミナの笑顔
Synopsis:
In a village in Asia, there is a family with five children. Mina and her husband, Jai who never learnt to read and write, work in the field.
One day, Jai suddenly falls ill from stomach cramps. Mina urgently looks for medicine, but she can't find the right container among so many different kinds. Mina decides to go to the clinic in town with the empty bottle.
When she reaches the clinic, the doctor is surprised by the bottle she has brought. The bottle is not for medicine, but for pesticide! When she returns home Mina tells Jai what happened in town. And she tells him frankly that she wants to attend literacy class.
The story tells you what problems illiterates in Asia and the Pacific are facing and shows the importance of literacy.

(Source: ACCU)

Title: Kie Saranu Kizuato: Hi no Umi Osaka
Japanese: 消えさらぬ傷あと 火の海・大阪
Synopsis: An educational film about the bombing of Osaka in 1945.

Title: Okaasan no Yasashii te
Japanese: おかあさんのやさしい手
Synopsis: An educational film highlighting the importance of how impressionable children are by their family members.

Title: Ranma ½: 1994 Music Calendar
Japanese: らんま1/2 1994年ミュージックカレンダー
Synopsis:
Series clips shown along with the music that freeze-frames when a new move is shown. The writing at the bottom says "Anything-Goes Martial Arts Technique/Trick Picture Scroll". This was put out by the KAC (Kitty Animation Circle), and so it wasn't commercially available in stores.

(Source: furinkan.com/ranma/anime/specials.html)

Title: Wasurerumonka!
Japanese: わすれるもんか！
Synopsis: An educational film meant to inspire people and to not pity those with disabilities.

Title: Muka Muka Paradise: Okaasan to Manabu Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: ムカムカパラダイス お母さんと学ぶ交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety anime starring the cast of Muka Muka Paradise.

Title: Let's Go Nakama-tachi!: Bokura to Hakase no Bouka no Chikai
Japanese: レッツゴーなかまたち！ ―ぼくらと博士の防火の誓い―
Synopsis: An educational film about a boy learning fire safety. He uses his new knowledge to teach the elderly the same.

Title: Saigo no Kuushuu: Kumagaya
Japanese: 最後の空襲 KUMAGAYA
Synopsis:
The central character is a 7 year old girl called Sachiko.  She has just lost her immediate family in the firebombing of Tokyo and takes the train to her uncle’s family in Kumagaya in Saitama Prefecture.  She is not out of danger yet, for the train gets shot at by a plane along the journey.  Her uncle meets her at the station and he and his whole family welcome her with open arms.  With her cousins, Sachiko explores the beauty of the natural landscape around Kumagaya.

Sadly, these beautiful days of late summer are not to last.  The final movement of the film depicts the final air raid of the war.  The city descends into fear and chaos and Sachiko gets separated from her family with tragic results.  

(Source: Nishikataeiga)

Title: Okane wa Mawaru: Kurashi to Kinyuu
Japanese: お金は回る －くらしと金融－
Synopsis:
Educational video that teaches youth about the value of money and importance of financial planning.

*Part of the series of films produced with cooperation of: Japan's Central Council for Financial Services Information and Bank of Japan Public Relations Department.

Title: Yuu☆Yuu☆Hakusho: Mu Mu Hakusho - Nightmare Hakusho
Japanese: 幽☆遊☆白書 夢夢白書
Synopsis: A four part OVA series including Yusuke's weird dreams.

Title: Kogitsune no Okurimono
Japanese: こぎつねのおくりもの
Synopsis: Three child kitsune break a precious family portrait an old lady had trying to get the offerings she usually leaves for them.

Title: Kitsune no Kan Chigai
Japanese: きつねのかんちがい
Synopsis: An educational film about how some religious beliefs and folklore and superstitions are in damaging in modern Japan.

Title: Uchuu Bouei-tai Taabou no Shinkirou Hoshi wo Sukue!
Japanese: 宇宙防衛隊たあ坊のしんきろう星を救え!
Synopsis: King Kaniwa has robbed the flower's "preciousness" which gives life to all stars. Taabou stands up to rescue the desert star.

Title: Tetsuwan Atom no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: 鉄腕アトムの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Tetsuwan Atom. Its purpose educate elementary school children that the leading cause of death involving children and automobiles, is that the children are jumping into the road when they're not supposed to be. Meaning that children using crosswalks lawfully or children inside vehicles that crash, are very unlikely to die, and that children themselves must protect themselves over something easily avoidable and obey traffic laws.

Title: Mario Kirby Meisaku Video
Japanese: マリオ・カービィ 名作ビデオ
Synopsis:
An educational video only released in Japan, and stars Mario and Kirby, both on their own separate adventures. It is aimed at teaching young children Kanji/Chinese characters.

(Source: Kirby Wiki)

Title: Henteko na Volunteer
Japanese: へんてこなボランティア
Synopsis: An educational film about the merits of volunteer work. A group of children help achieve a grandmother's dream of learning how to read and write.

Title: Tenchi Muyou! Ryououki: Heianmuyo! Picture Drama
Japanese: 天地無用! 魎皇鬼 謹製びでお絵本 平安無用!
Synopsis:
A standalone Tenchi Muyou Ryououki picture drama released as a part of PAC on VHS and seemingly around the same time on laser disc.

The premise of Tenchi Muyou! Ryououki: Heian Muyo! has Aeka, Yosho (in his Katsuhito form), Tenchi, Mihoshi, Ryou-Ouki, and Ryouko in the Heian era (794 AD to 1185) of Japan. Tenchi and Mihoshi are samurai partners on their way to slay a demon, while Aeka longs for Tenchi's return.

(Source: anime.astronerdboy.com, edited)

Title: Hinamatsuri
Japanese: ひなまつり
Synopsis: An educational anime about the history and founding of the Hinamatsuri holiday in Japan.

Title: Shouka Robo Zeres: Fire Dragon wo Taose!
Japanese: 消火ロボゼウレス ファイアドラゴンを倒せ！
Synopsis: A fire safety anime with a sci-fi mecha flare. When an ocarina is blown, the mecha Zeres arrives to extinguish the flames.

Title: Kero Kero Keroppi no Bokura no Ohimesama
Japanese: けろけろけろっぴのぼくらのお姫さま
Synopsis: Keroleen gets teleported to a fantasy land through a magical pond. There is a handsome prince who charms her. He wants her to visit more but the boys discover that his kingdom is not a righteous one. The gang has to go save Keroleen and the fate of their town from the false prince.

Title: Uchuu Bouei-tai Taabou no Toki no Tomatta Hoshi
Japanese: 宇宙防衛隊たあ坊の時の止まった星
Synopsis: The stars have stopped moving! It's up to Taabou to find out what's causing them to freeze in time.

Title: Hare Tokidoki Buta: Noriyasu-kun no Hi no Youjin
Japanese: はれときどきぶた のりやすくんの火の用心
Synopsis: A fire safety video starring the cast of Hare Tokidoki Buta. This version uses the film's art style and character personalities.

Title: Time Slip 1923: Mori no Miracle Jishin Taiken
Japanese: タイムスリップ1923 守のミラクル地震体験
Synopsis: It's September 1st and a girl is riding her motorcycle that her grandpa built for her when she suddenly time slips to 1923, the same day as the Great Kanto earthquake. Here she meets her grandpa as a child and learns how to extinguish the fire of a neighbor's house. It is meant to be an educational film shown at schools.

Title: Doraemon: Nobita to Mirai Note
Japanese: ドラえもん のび太と未来ノート
Synopsis:
Educational video produced by the New Energy and Industrial Technology Development Organization (NEDO) in 1994, it was later included on the 13th issue of Boku, Doraemon magazine released on August 20, 2004.

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Susume! Godzilland
Japanese: すすめ！ゴジランド
Synopsis: Advance! Godzilland is a series of four educational OVAs released on VHS in 1994 and 1996 by Gakken. They use Godzilla and other kaiju to teach children about hiragana, counting, addition, and subtraction.

Title: Mebuki
Japanese: 芽吹き
Synopsis: An educational film about listening to your inner voice when you see discrimination. Social customs and values should not override cruelty and abuse done upon others.

Title: Yuujou no Kickoff
Japanese: 友情のキックオフ
Synopsis: Makoto was a great soccer player in his elementary school team. When he moves to another school he is bullied. Through football he is able to turn their actions around.

Title: Helen to Tomoni: Anne Sullivan
Japanese: ヘレンと共に アニー・サリバン-
Synopsis:
Anne Sullivan is the woman who became a tutor for Helen Keller, a girl who was deaf, dumb, and blind. Anne decides to be her tutor to give Helen joy of life, no matter how little. She stays with Helen all the time and dedicates herself to Helen's education. However, things doesn't go as well as she expects and she has a very difficult time day to day. On the other side, she has hope, and teaches braille to Helen. One summer’s day, Helen was given well water in her hand, and finally she understood the meaning of the word 'Water'.

(Source: Official Site)

Title: Moldiver Ex
Japanese: Unknown
Synopsis:
The first episode (Go Go! Doll-chan), 12 minutes long, features Mirai working as a rollerskating waitress who encounters the Neophytes in their normal day jobs. At the end we are shown a preview for the 1st Moldiver OVA episode but the text on screen advertises all 6 episodes going on sale. The preview also features a bit of footage that did not make it into the actual final cut of episode 1.

The second episode (Project F), 10 minutes long, features the Neophytes working an undercover gig trying to get a MSX computer for Professor Arnagi's old technology collection.

Title: Hanshin Awaji Daishinsai ni Manabu: Boku wa, Ano Hi wo Wasurenai.
Japanese: 阪神淡路大震災に学ぶ 僕は、あの日を忘れない。
Synopsis: An educational film about the Great Hanshin earthquake (aka Kobe earthquake).

Title: Sonotoki Kimi wa?: Ryouta to Pikari no Jishin Bousai Gaku
Japanese: その時君は？ －良太とピカリの地震防災学－
Synopsis: An elementary school boy experiences an big earthquake. He's experienced earthquakes before but not one of this scale. It did some extensive damage and he decides to learn about earthquake recovery. How things are done and why things are done in specific orders.

Title: Nanoha
Japanese: 菜の花
Synopsis: An educational film about the history of the Buraku class.

Title: Chikyuu no Himitsu
Japanese: 地球の秘密
Synopsis:
A two-part video series under the auspices of the Japanese Department of the Environment. An environmentally themed story.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

Title: Donguri to Yamaneko (1995)
Japanese: どんぐりと山猫
Synopsis: A retelling of Miyazawa Kenji's story of The Acorns and the Wildcat.

Title: Ningen Kakumei
Japanese: 人間革命
Synopsis: Based on the saga novel "The Human Revolution" by Daisuke Ikeda published in 1974-1999.

Title: Tenki ni Naare
Japanese: 天気になあれ
Synopsis: An educational anime about the 1960's adult literacy movement especially amongst what was the female buraku people in Japan which paved way for truly free state education in Japan.

Title: A Piece of Phantasmagoria
Japanese: a piece of PHANTASMAGORIA (ア・ピース・オブ ファンタスマゴリア)
Synopsis: A collection of 15 short episodes depicting the magic world of Phantasmagoria.

Title: Tobira wo Akete (1995)
Japanese: トビラを開けて
Synopsis:
It's bedtime, and Nonoko is about to go to sleep. But the play of light and shadow on those objects on the wall look almost like... a person. 

(Source: ANN)

Title: Aishiteru yo McCrea: McCrea no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: あいしてるよマクリー マクリーの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety anime starring the cast of Aishiteru yo McCrea. It was a picture book story from the children's program "Haha to Ko no TV Ehon" written by the actress Yoko Akino. The story was then created into a real picture book.

Title: Doctor X no Jitensha Anzen Seminar
Japanese: ドクターＸの自転車安全セミナー
Synopsis: Satoru, Akira and Ichiro are riding bicycles, weaving between people walking when they nearly collide with a car at an intersection.  They are saved by Doctor X who sends them a letter with alternative future photographs. They are pictures of the accident, showing the outcome of their lives had he not been there.

Title: Kumori Nochi Hare
Japanese: くもりのち晴れ
Synopsis: An educational film about bullying, it follows a girl who is bullied so much that she loses the ability to speak.

Title: Souta no Chikai: Sabetsu ni Makenai Chikara
Japanese: 草太の誓い－差別に負けない力－
Synopsis: An educational film about how farmers and townspeople during the Edo period were considered low class citizens and constantly at the end of unprovoked discrimination.

Title: Ichiban Chikaku ni
Japanese: いちばん近くに
Synopsis: An educational film about the discrimination of ethnic Koreans in the Osaka Prefecture.

Title: Somei-ka no Hi no Youjin: Bouka no Tebiki Katei-hen
Japanese: 染井家の火の用心 防火のてびき 家庭編
Synopsis: An educational fire safety video for kids and their families at home.

Title: Nijiiro no Fushigina Ishi
Japanese: にじいろのふしぎないし
Synopsis: An educational film meant to teach children to walk a mile in other people's shoes. Kids who are mean may be having a tough life at home and this is their way of coping. By helping each other out can heal the hearts of everyone.

Title: Aoi Meno Ningyou Monogatari
Japanese: 青い目の人形物語
Synopsis:
The "Blue-eyed Dolls" were given in 1927 by the USA, under the leadership of Dr. Gulick, to Japanese elementary schools and kindergartens for the purpose of Japanese-American friendship.

About 12,000 "Blue-eyed Dolls" were given by the USA. However, with the outbreak of the Pacific War (World War II) in 1941, a great number of the "Blue-eyed Dolls," who were considered to be "dolls of the enemy country," were disposed of by being burned or by being stabbed with bamboo spears. 

This is the story of children trying to rescue the doll.

(Source: wgordon.web.wesleyan.edu)

Title: Hachikadzuki-hime
Japanese: 鉢かづき姫
Synopsis: An anime adaptation of the Hachikadzuki-hime Japanese folk tale.

Title: Makehen de! Roku-nen San-kumi no Hanshin Daishinsai
Japanese: 負けへんで！ ６年３組の阪神大震災
Synopsis: An educational film about the Great Hanshin earthquake (aka Kobe earthquake), focusing on a class and how they bounced back from their sorrow.

Title: Ikite Iru
Japanese: 生きている
Synopsis: Tsuyoshi is 9 years old and had friends over to play. During a tumble a photo breaks of his mother holding a baby. On the back of the photo is a date, written two years before his birth, so Tsuyoshi asks his father "whose child is this?" His father tells him the story of his older brother who died at birth and learns the importance of life.

Title: Oyako de Manabu: Kaji no Youjin - Jishin no Youjin
Japanese: 親子で学ぶ 火事の用心 地震の用心
Synopsis: An educational fire safety and earthquake safety short starring the cast of Oyako Club. The film was meant to be shown for parents and children together so that they may devise strategies as a family.

Title: Hakkiri Kotowarou: Yuukai Sare Nai zo!
Japanese: はっきりことわろう 誘拐されないぞ！
Synopsis: An anime showing three common kidnapping scenarios for children to avoid so that they may protect themselves if it happens in real life.

Title: Hashire John
Japanese: 走れジョン
Synopsis: Tatsuya Obayashi rescued a dog from a vacant lot and named him John. He's a bit slow and Tatsuya raised his voice when John couldn't bring back the frisbee as fast. The next day Yoshio transfers into Tatsuya's class. He wants to be friends but Yoshio began to get bullied. With the help of John, Tatsuya learns how to be patient and help stand up for his classmate.

Title: Honou no Senshi: Firegirl
Japanese: 炎の戦士 ファイアーガール
Synopsis: An educational fire safety anime commissioned by the Tokyo Fire Department. It stars a girl whose family died in a fire due to arson. She herself was severely burned and disfigured and barely alive. She was taken to the hospital and given a cyborg body which gave her powers to transform into Firegirl, so she can fight fire disasters and to teach kids fire safety as well as notifying a figure of authority if they see someone who might be committing arson.

Title: Youbi Masochist Animation
Japanese: 妖美マゾアニメーション
Synopsis:
Based on the work of Harukawa Namio. Features various stills with minimal animation of fairly large bottomed women sitting on men's faces, subsequently urinating in their mouths.

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Boku no Aozora
Japanese: ぼくの青空
Synopsis: An educational film about child's battle with muscular dystrophy.

Title: Chibi Maruko-chan no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: ちびまる子ちゃんの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Chibi Maruko-chan.

Title: Nibiki no Neko to Genkina Kazoku
Japanese: 二匹の猫と元気な家族
Synopsis: An educational film following a family that moved to Tokyo after the Kobe earthquake and the passive discrimination they received.

Title: Shounen H ga Mita Sensou
Japanese: 少年Ｈが見た戦争
Synopsis: An educational anime about the Pacific War. Based on the autobiographical best selling work by Kappa Senoo.

Title: Naita Aka Oni (OVA)
Japanese: 泣いた赤おに
Synopsis: A red Oni wants to become friends with the villagers but is finding it hard because a blue Oni is terrorizing them.

Title: Ki wo Tsukeyou: Douro wa Kiken ga Ippai!
Japanese: 気をつけよう 道路は危険がいつぱい！
Synopsis: An educational film teaching about traffic safety within a city.

Title: Makeruna! Senta: Sayonara Ijime Mushi
Japanese: 負けるな！千太～さよならいじめ虫～
Synopsis: Human beings as well as other creatures have a cruel heart. Everyone thinks that all they're doing is bullying insects. In this anime each individual is confronted with the bullying and asked about it; their replies show the ugliness of their own hearts.

Title: Cello Hiki no Gauche (OVA)
Japanese: セロひきのゴーシュ
Synopsis: Gauche is having trouble perfecting his piece for his performance in 10 days when he hears a knock on his door...

Title: Mahoutsukai Tai! vs. Shamanic Princess
Japanese: 魔法使いTai! vs シャーマニックプリンセス
Synopsis:
A parody-esque epilogue to both Shamanic Princess and Mahou Tsukai Tai!. 

As a marketing ploy back when Shamanic Princess was first released, buyers who purchased all six first edition LD's of both Shamanic Princess and Magic User's Club, and sent in their proof of purchases before a deadline received a special OVA entitled Shamanic Princess vs. Magic User's Club. It was never sold in stores and was a special omake by the series' creators to the fans. The OVA contains an epilogue to both series, which is fitting considering they both came out at the same time.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Title: Nudl Nude
Japanese: 누들누드
Synopsis:
Korean animation consisting of 14 erotic/comedic animated shorts.

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Yakusoku: Africa Mizu to Midori
Japanese: 約束 －アフリカ 水と緑－
Synopsis: An educational film about technology and perseverance can help those less fortunate. In the film's example, it's building a green wall and green sanctuary to combat the spreading desert in Africa in order for native Africans to have a better life.

Title: DS Anime Soushuuhen '98
Japanese: ＤＳアニメ総集編 '98
Synopsis: A compilation release featuring 17 short skits about the characters from Compile's video game series. Some of these shorts were also bundled with DiscStation volumes 13-16, a magazine by Compile.

Title: Wao-kun no Hane
Japanese: ワオくんのはね
Synopsis: An educational film about childhood bullying. The goal is to teach children that it's okay to speak up and say "stop it" and "I don't like it" and to tell adults if they are getting bullied. Sometimes the person doesn't realize they are a bully because they might see it as rough housing. By conveying your feelings, everyone can get along.

Title: 25-bu de Wakaru Tegata Kogitte no Hanashi
Japanese: 25分で分かる手形・小切手のはなし
Synopsis: This is a video that explains the basics of bills and checks.

Title: Kitsune to Budou
Japanese: きつねとぶどう
Synopsis: An educational film about planning for the future. The story focuses on a fox pup that wants to eat all the grape off a new plant. His mother tells him not to and he didn't understand why. When he grows up he goes back to the area where the small grape plant was to find that it's now a big sturdy vine with lots of fruit. He thanks his mother in heaven for showing him his haste to eat from the plant when it was small would have killed the plant, and thus not have grown large with bountiful fruit in the future.

Title: Ojiichan no Tomato
Japanese: おじいちゃんのトマト
Synopsis: An educational film concerning the bullying and discrimination of elderly handicapped people.

Title: Mina no Mura to Kawa
Japanese: ミナの村と川
Synopsis:
Mina's village life seems peaceful as ever, yet some changes in their environment begin to affect their daily life. One evening, Mina's family get food poisoning from eating polluted river fish. Later that evening, a heavy rainstorm hits the village, and water from the polluted river flows into the well. Having taken medicine with unboiled well water, the family's health condition worsens. Mina, having learnt the causes of her family's illness, decides to improve the village environment.

(Source: ACCU)

Title: Ojiichan no Hanabi
Japanese: おじいちゃんの花火
Synopsis: An educational film showing the importance of connectence between people even when you fail in certain aspects of your life.

Title: Hana Saki Yama
Japanese: 花さき山
Synopsis:
Aya goes to mountain and meets a mountain witch, who tells her that when she does one good thing one flower comes out.

(Source: Amazon.com)

Title: Hotaru no Mau Machi de
Japanese: 蛍の舞う街で
Synopsis: An educational film showing the importance of family bonding.

Title: Jun ga Kureta Inochi
Japanese: 純がくれた命
Synopsis:
Kenichi is a 1st year middle school student who can not endure repeated bullying. He jump out of the window on the third floor of the school to try to commit suicide. However, he miraculously regained his life. At the hospital where he was brought in, Kenichi will be in the same room as Jun Hayashi, an older kid who is suffering from heart disease and can only move in a wheelchair.

Students from class come visit Kenichi with his mother. He didn't have a lively face and found out that the class thinks he fell out of the window as an accident while cleaning it and told his mother that which she believes. 

Jun has a brighter outlook on life and shows Kenichi his drive to live even though the world is so against him. They two grow closer together and vow to eat great ramen one day. The night before Jun's surgery they accomplish that ramen journey and on the way to the operating room, Jun yells at Kenichi "if you commit suicide, give me your life. If you don't need it, please give it to me!"

Everyday Kenichi gets to eat good food, play good games, and do whatever he wants (even to go to school, he can even change schools too) which Jun never even has the opportunity to do because of his heart. Kenichi's will to live is reignited, because there are people out there will even less who would gladly trade their life for his bullied one.

Title: Minna de Tonda
Japanese: みんなで跳んだ
Synopsis: An educational film about compassion. The story follows a class trying to break a jump rope record and one student is terrible at the task. The issue causes a divide in the classroom.

Title: Kiniro no Kujira
Japanese: 金色のクジラ
Synopsis: An educational film about leukemia in Japan.

Title: Hello Kitty no Santa-san ga Futari Ita
Japanese: ハローキティのサンタさんが二人いた
Synopsis: What if there were two Santas? When Santa-san doesn't receive a single Christmas letter he wonders if everyone forgot. But no, that's impossible! Someone else secretly took the letters and he's on the case to find the second Santa.

Title: Donguri Mori e
Japanese: どんぐり森へ
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Shiranpuri
Japanese: しらんぷり
Synopsis: An educational film about bullying.

Title: Hyakumannen Attara, Dousuru?
Japanese: 100万円あったら、どうする？
Synopsis:
Educational video that teaches teenagers about value of money, basic banking principles, use of credit cards and other ways of financial interaction in the society.

*Part of the series of films produced with cooperation of: Japan's Central Council for Financial Services Information and Bank of Japan Public Relations Department.

Title: Arisa☆Good Luck
Japanese: ありさ☆Good Luck
Synopsis:
Arisa, a 16-year-old high school girl, accidentally has an extreme fighting suit that her brother invented implanted in her body. It's a slightly embarrassing suit that makes her emit an H voice when she transforms. Moreover, from that day on, Arisa is forced against her will to fight a secret society of evil.

"Oh, I want to tell my feelings to Matsumoto-senpai, the man of my dreams, but only when I do so, I transform into an H battle suit."

(Source: AllCinema, translated)

Title: Shutter Chance
Japanese: シャッターチャンス
Synopsis: An educational film showing the importance of perusing dreams and the depression that occurs when parents force their children's careers into what they want rather than what the child wants.

Title: Ao no Doumon
Japanese: 青の洞門
Synopsis:
Legend has it that before the tunnel (Ao no Doumon) was built, people had to climb over the cliffs through which the tunnel is built to reach an important local shrine. The path was very dangerous and people regularly fell to their deaths. During the Edo period, a Buddhist monk named Zenkai, who had committed a murder in his earlier life, decided to build a safe passage for worshipers in order to atone for his crime. Beginning at the age of 49, he dedicated 30 years of his life to digging the 185 metre tunnel by hand, using only a hammer and chisel.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Title: Nyanpara no Nakama-tachi
Japanese: ニャンパラの仲間たち
Synopsis: An educational fire and police safety video aimed at preschoolers and kindergartners.

Title: Devilman Memorial
Japanese: デビルマン メモリアル
Synopsis: Summary of the 1972 Devilman series.

Title: Kunoichi Gakuen Ninpouchou
Japanese: くノ一学園忍法帖
Synopsis:
As night arrives the shadows of Koga fall on Iga and a new threat exists for our lusty vixens. After a torid sexual encounter Yatsurugi Shinobu's best friend Mashiba Aya is infected with a parasitic bug and succumbs to its will. Having the same insatiable urges, the same tragedy is about to happen to Kage Lena. The only known antidote is stored deep within the labs of the Koga Institute and is the only thing which will save Kage Lena.

(Source: AniDB.net)

Title: Hare Tokidoki Buta no Jishin Youjin Nikki
Japanese: はれときどきぶたの地震用心日記
Synopsis: An earthquake safety video starring the cast of Hare Tokidoki Buta (TV). This version uses the TV series' art style and character personalities.

Title: Nudl Nude 2
Japanese: 누들누드 2
Synopsis:
Sequel of Nudl Nude.

Korean animation consisting of 15 erotic/comedic animated shorts. 

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Hato yo: Hiroshima no Sora wo
Japanese: はとよ ひろしまの空を
Synopsis:
Based on a book of the same name. 

An anime about the atomic bombing of Hiroshima. The focus is a middle school boy who kept and bred carrier pigeons. While he was out of the city training them, the bomb dropped. Both he and the pigeon desperately tried to find their mother and child respectively in the chaos.

Title: Inochi Kagayaku Akari
Japanese: いのち輝く灯
Synopsis: An educational film about women's problems, community discrimination (buraku social issues), and the entrapment of disabilities.

Title: Hare Tokidoki Buta no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: はれときどきぶたの交通安全
Synopsis: A traffic safety video starring the cast of Hare Tokidoki Buta (TV). This version uses the TV series' art style and character personalities.

Title: Chibi Maruko-chan no Konna Nori Kata Abunai yo
Japanese: ちびまる子ちゃんのこんな乗りかたあぶないよ
Synopsis: A Chibi Maruko-chan bicycle safety film helping teach kids how to ride on the shoulder of the road.

Title: Nanatsu no Hoshi
Japanese: 七つのほし
Synopsis:
Based on Leo Tolstoy's retelling of the The Big Dipper.

A young girl from a village suffering from a drought goes in search of water for her sick mother.

Title: Kaitou Gary no Nihonjin Kouryakuhou!
Japanese: 怪盗ガリーの日本人攻略法!
Synopsis: An very short educational film aimed at adults about the dangers of traveling abroad. Deals with scams, criminals, theft, kidnapping, and other such ill acts in other countries.

Title: Shadow Skill (1999)
Japanese: 影技 (1999) [邪技 ぢゃどうすぎる]
Synopsis: Bonus OVA of Shadow Skill. Features two short comedy stories.

Title: Daruma-chan
Japanese: だるまちゃん
Synopsis:
Based on children's books of the same name for each episode. 

The story follows Daruma-chan and his interactions with other creatures like Rabbit-chan or Tengu-chan.

Title: Ichimai no Etegami
Japanese: 一枚の絵てがみ
Synopsis: An educational film about town planning and factoring the opinion of the elderly as they have lived there the longest.

Title: Shounen Muku Hatojuu Monogatari
Japanese: 少年むくはとじゅう物語
Synopsis: An educational film that follows the famous Japanese writer Muku Hatojuu in his boyhood as he gets bullied.

Title: Mienu Me ni Kanjita Kumotoriyama no Asahi
Japanese: 見えぬ目に感じた雲取山の朝日
Synopsis: A woman climbs up the highest peak of the Kumotori moutain to see the sunrise. The awe-inspiring visual reminds her of her rough childhood.

Title: Hage
Japanese: はげ
Synopsis: An educational film about premature baldness. Specifically aimed at children balding.

Title: Tabi no Kisetsu
Japanese: 足袋の季節
Synopsis:
An educational film about overcoming material weakness.

A poor boy short changes the poor old daifuku-mochi seller lady constantly. The guilt racks up and he goes to apologize to her with all the money he stole...only to find that she had died recently.

Title: Yonimo Osoroshii Nihon Mukashibanashi
Japanese: 世にも恐ろしい日本昔話
English: The Truth of Japanese Fairy Tales
Synopsis:
The horrible truths behind Japanese Fairy Tales from the ancient times are finally revealed! This title includes three episodes: "The Monkey and the Crab", "Click-Crack Mountain" and "Urashima and the Kingdom beneath the Sea".

(Source: Official Website)

Title: Hanamaru Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: はなまる交通安全
Synopsis: An educational film about traffic safety staring Hanamaru.

Title: Amigo Tomodachi
Japanese: アミーゴ 友だち
Synopsis: An educational film about how difficult it is learning the culture and customs of a new land. And how bullying foreigners or even Japanese people who have come back home after an extended stay in a foreign country after they picked up the customs, is the manifestation of a weak consciousness.

Title: Soba no Hana Saita Hi
Japanese: そばの花さいた日
Synopsis: An educational film about environmentalism.

Title: Tobidashicha dame!
Japanese: とびだしちゃダメ！
Synopsis: An educational film about traffic safety.

Title: Kakusensou
Japanese: 核戦争
Synopsis: An educational film about nuclear warfare and the effects it has on the environment as told by a talking frog.

Title: Ojiichan wa Boku no Hero
Japanese: おじいちゃんはボクのヒーロー
Synopsis: An educational film for Respect for the Aged Day.

Title: Wheels
Japanese: WHEELS
Synopsis: Directed and animated by Hotchi Kazuhiro.

Title: Mother Teresa
Japanese: マザー・テレサ
Synopsis: A biographical anime about Mother Teresa.

Title: Ojarumaru: Chitchai Mono no Ookina Chikara
Japanese: おじゃる丸 ちっちゃいものの大きなちから
Synopsis: An educational film about the importance of helping people starring the Ojarumaru cast.

Title: Kumo no Ito (2000)
Japanese: くもの糸
Synopsis: Kandata was a thief in life so he suffers in hell because of it. But once before he died he helped a spider. One day a silk thread comes down from above and Kandata attempts to climb it in order to reach paradise but...

Title: Ijime Juuyon-sai no Message
Japanese: いじめ１４歳のＭｅｓｓａｇｅ
Synopsis: An educational film based on an award winning novel. The story follows a girl who is bullied to the point of hospitalization even when she requested the help of adults and teachers.

Title: Shiokari Touge
Japanese: 塩狩峠
Synopsis:
Based on Miura Ayako's literary work.

Tells the story of Nagano Nobuo from his childhood in Tokyo, through a gradual journey of self-discovery and acceptance of the Christian faith, to his death in Shiokari Pass in Hokkaido.

(Source: Jclglobal)

Title: Ojarumaru no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: おじゃる丸の交通安全
Synopsis: Traffic safety video starring the cast of Ojarumaru.

Title: Gomen ne Chitchi
Japanese: ごめんね チッチ
Synopsis: An educational film aimed at lower elementary schoolers. It teaches about how pets rely on us to be taken care of. Dogs need attention and to be properly exercised. It does something bad, they don't understand when you beat them. And if you neglect them, they die which no amount of "I'm sorry" can fix.

Title: Mina no Mura to Mori
Japanese: ミナの村と森
Synopsis:
While Mina's family is in the forest, fire breaks out. They decide to take care of Lolo, the baby monkey, who lost his home and family due to the forest fire. An environmentalist visits Mina's village and invites the villagers to the field to talk about the forest. Having realized the importance of the forest, Mina and the villagers decide to plant trees in the burned field.

(Source: ACCU)

Title: Ten ni Yaka Reru: E ni Yoru Shougen
Japanese: 天に焼かれる ～絵による証言～
Synopsis: A documentary style anime about the atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima.

Title: Nogiku no Haka
Japanese: 野菊の墓
Synopsis:
An educational film about love and respect. 

Tamiko (17) and Masao (15) are cousins. They grew up together as siblings but in adulthood they wanted to wed each other. However Tamiko's sister-in-law was jealous and tried to tear them apart by forcing Tamiko to marry another man.

Title: Yonimo Osoroshii Grimm Douwa
Japanese: 世にも恐ろしいグリム童話
Synopsis:
The truth behind the well-known Grimm's Tales is cruel and full of blood and lust!

Episode 1: "Hansel & Gretel": Two brothers lost in the woods were actually criminals...

Episode 2: "The Blue Beard": The true character of the Blue Beard was a cannibal who was unable to tolerate his wife's adultery. 

Episode 3: "Cinderella": Actually Cinderella had abnormal affections toward the prince.

Title: Haha Uzura
Japanese: 母うずら
Synopsis: An educational anime about the importance of life. A boy and his father go hunting. The boy shoots a quail only to find a nest of chicks nearby.

Title: Genkichi Jiisan to Kogitsune
Japanese: 源吉じいさんと子ぎつね
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Mimizuku to Tsuki-sama
Japanese: みみずくとお月さま
Synopsis: An educational film about playground bullying.

Title: Kokoro no Hanataba
Japanese: 心の花たば
Synopsis: A sweet story about an old man who went around town planting seeds everywhere in order for flowers to bloom for his granddaughter.

Title: Shibuzome Ikki: Ashita ni Kakeru Niji
Japanese: 渋染一揆～明日にかける虹～
Synopsis: An educational film about the Shibuzome Uprising.

Title: Inori no Te
Japanese: いのりの手
Synopsis: An educational anime about Hans Dürer.

Title: Dimension Loop
Japanese: 次元ループ
Synopsis:
The "story" of an apparitious extraterrestrial and a vertically mobile prepubescent.

(Source: ANN)

Title: Gin no Rousokutate
Japanese: 銀のろうそく立て
Synopsis: A retelling of Victor Hugo's crime from Les Misérables.

Title: Utsukushii Message
Japanese: 美しいメッセージ
Synopsis: An educational film about discrimination in Japan.

Title: Onna Spy Goumon: Teki no Ajito wa Jotai Goumonsho
Japanese: 女スパイ拷問 敵の基地は女体拷問所
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Ojamajo Doremi OVA
Japanese: おジャ魔女どれみの交通安全, おジャ魔女どれみの自転車安全教室
Synopsis:
Traffic Safety: Onpu teaches traffic safety.
Bicycle Safety Classroom: Momoko teaches bicycle safety.
Let's!! Cooking: Learn how to make special treats!

(Source: Royal Patraine)

Title: Kyoro-chan no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: キョロちゃんの交通安全
Synopsis: Traffic safety video starring the cast of Kyoro-chan.

Title: Kimari no Nai Kuni
Japanese: きまりのないくに
Synopsis: Kiriko likes doing fun things even if it meant breaking the rules. One day they wake up and find the world different, there are no rules! But it's horrible, Kiriko realizes just how terrible and lonely it is in a world full of anarchy. From now on they promise to follow the rules, and in doing so, Kiriko makes new friends.

Title: Gundam Evolve
Japanese: ガンダムEVOLVE
Synopsis:
A series of short films packaged with certain model kits and aired at conventions, the Gundam Evolve series chronicles a number of side-stories, alternative scenes, and even bonus omake from all around the Gundam canon. Featuring a mix of animation media—from traditional cels to 3-D CG rendering to even cel-shaded 2-D animation—these often 3-5 minute shorts cover such events as Domon Kasshu's training (and a bit of a romantic tift with Rain Mikamura) from G Gundam, Amuro Ray battling Quess Paraya from Char's Counterattack, Kamille Bidan training in the Gundam Mk.II from Zeta Gundam, and Canard Pars dueling Prayer Reverie from the Gundam SEED X Astray manga.

(Source: ANN)

Title: Nidoto Touranai Tabibito
Japanese: 二度と通らない旅人
Synopsis: A traveler seeking protection from a storm knocks on the door of a house. The family turns him away as they have a sick daughter and don't want the trouble. The traveler pities the daughter and gives them medicine. A doctor comes to visit next and says that's the medicine the daughter needs. The takes it and gets better. The family is ashamed of their inhospitality and promise to let the traveler stay if they come by again. The traveler ever did.

Title: Yume, Sora Takaku
Japanese: 夢、空高く
Synopsis: An educational film about the independence of children.

Title: Kyoro-chan no Jishin Youjin Hi no Youjin
Japanese: キョロちゃんの 地震用心・火の用心
Synopsis: An educational film about fire safety starring Kyoro-chan.

Title: 21 Seiki wa Minna ga Shuyaku
Japanese: 21世紀はみんなが主役
Synopsis: An educational film about gender equality in society in the 21st century.

Title: Afghanistan Paghman-mura no Monogatari: Sekaiichi Utsukushii Boku no Mura
Japanese: アフガニスタン・パグマン村の物語 せかいいち うつくしい ぼくの村
Synopsis: An educational film about Paghman, Afghanistan showing the simple life and beauty of the region and its regular citizens to juxtapose the War in Afghanistan that stared in real life the year prior.

Title: Kii-chan Watashi, Umarete Kite Yokatta!
Japanese: きいちゃん 私、生まれてきてよかった！
Synopsis: An educational film about how a girl with a disability is able to overcome her restricted lifestyle and sew a yukata for her sister's wedding. The lesson is that those with disabilities are not limited to a life of nothing, that with encouragement and positive attitudes of the people around them--they are able to great things like everyone else leaving with the tag line of the movie "I'm glad I was born".

Title: Miitsuketa!
Japanese: みーつけた！
Synopsis: An educational film about children's inability to value life in Japan. In the movie's example, members of a class neglect their rabbit duties and it dies.

Title: Ijime Stop! Kintarou Kokoro Chikaramochi
Japanese: いじめストップ！ 金太郎心のちからもち
Synopsis: Folktale hero Kintarou is here to teach about how bullying is bad.

Title: Mirai Shouboushi Kyuuta
Japanese: みらいしょうぼうし キュータ
Synopsis: An educational fire safety anime starring Tokyo's fire fighter mascot, Kyuuta. An English version of the video is available at the Tokyo Fire Department museum.

Title: Detective Conan OVA 02: 16 Suspects
Japanese: 名探偵コナン 16人の容疑者!?
Synopsis:
Conan Edogawa and the rest of the gang are invited to Inspector Ninzaburou Shiratori's villa for a small gathering. The party's highlight is Shiratori's prized wine collection—including his most expensive vintage—and a bottle from it will be served for the evening. However, just as this wine is to be brought out, Shiratori finds the bottle smashed on the floor—and the culprit can only be among the 16 people present in the gathering.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Afghanistan Paghman-mura no Monogatari: Boku no Mura ni Circus ga Kita
Japanese: アフガニスタン・パグマン村の物語 ぼくの村にサーカスがきた
Synopsis: Following the previous story, a circus comes to town displaced by the War in Afghanistan. This one has a stronger focus on the actual war affecting the citizens.

Title: Nyanta no Otanjoubi wa Kaji Sawagi!
Japanese: ニャン太のおたんじょう日は火事さわぎ！
Synopsis:
Nyanta wants to fry a donut on behalf of his mom for her birthday. He ends up setting the house on fire.

Nyanta no Otanjoubi wa Kaji Sawagi! teaches fire safety to children.

Title: Hikaru no Go: Sabaki no Ikkyoku! Inishie no Hana yo Sake!!
Japanese: ヒカルの碁 特別編 - 裁きの一局! いにしえの華よ咲け!!
Synopsis: Alternate version of the story featured in episode 64 of Hikaru no Go.

Title: Kokoro no Koukyougaku
Japanese: こころの交響楽
Synopsis: An educational film about child abuse in Japan.

Title: Ichinen Ikkumi
Japanese: 1ねん1くみ
Synopsis:
Based on a well known children's book series by Ryugi Goto (Story) and Hasegawa Tomoko (Illustrations).

Follows the adventure of a naughty boy and the rest of the kids in his classroom.

Title: Ikitemasu, 15-sai.
Japanese: 生きてます、15歳。
Synopsis: An educational film about blindness and being independent while blind in Japan.

Title: Boku no Diet Daisakusen
Japanese: ぼくのダイエット大作戦
Synopsis: An educational film about childhood obesity in Japan.

Title: Doudou
Japanese: Doudou
Synopsis: Independent animation by Hotchi Kazuhiro.

Title: Hidamari no Ie
Japanese: 陽だまりの家
Synopsis: An educational film about fatherless families and the elderly living alone in Japan

Title: Ji no Nai Hagaki
Japanese: 字のないはがき
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Utsu Musume Sayuri
Japanese: 打つ娘サユリ
Synopsis:
Sayuri is a curious creature who lives on her husband with her equally surreal mother and father. With an antenna-like whip protruding from her head, she is a striking daughter, and her long-awaited time to strike has come. Her family and friends watch eagerly as Sayuri carries out this bizarre ceremony.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Doubutsu Mura no World Cup: Yoiko no Koutsuu Anzen
Japanese: どうぶつ村のワールドカップ〜よい子のこうつうあんぜん〜
Synopsis: A children's traffic safety anime with a soccer theme in honor of the 2002 World Cup which was hosted in Japan and South Korea. Many children want to play the sport but it's easy for them to get into accidents chasing after balls in the street.

Title: Mebae no Ashita
Japanese: めばえの朝（あした）
Synopsis: An educational film about trying to see others by 'walking a mile in their shoes'. This one focuses on a listless teenager who is having trouble with his university entrance examinations and his father harping on him; and a pregnant woman who wants to work after the birth but her husband thinks it's wrong because a woman's place is in the home.

Title: Tottoko Hamtarou no Tottoko Daijida!! Bousai Kunren
Japanese: とっとこハム太郎のとっとこ大事だ!! 防災訓練
Synopsis:
The Ham-Hams practice safety! Hamtaro and the Ham-Hams learn what to do if there's an earthquake or a fire in this 13-minute long video produced by the Tokyo Emergency Service.

(Source: Hamatarou Wikia)

Title: Detective Conan OVA 03: Conan and Heiji and the Vanished Boy
Japanese: 名探偵コナン コナンと平次と消えた少年
Synopsis:
Conan and Ran are visiting Heiji and Kazuha in Osaka when the four come across a trio of kids while touring the city. These children, who look eerily similar to the Detective Boys but with different personalities, are looking for their friend who has gone missing—and the two young detectives agree to help find the vanished boy.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Tennis no Ouji-sama: Sonzoku Yama no Hi
Japanese: テニスの王子 存続山の日
English: Prince of Tennis A Day of the Survival Mountain
Synopsis:
The Seishun Academy Boys' Tennis team have gone off to the S.K.B Tennis Club for a one-day boot camp. The infamous "training from Hell" first tests the members as they run all the way up toward the mountainside club. Shortly after, they participate in specialized tennis practice that matches their specific playstyles. With the threat of Sadaharu Inui's new "Marvelous Surprise Inui Juice Excellent" awaiting any who fail to complete their daily tasks, the boys persevere through their exhaustion. 

A group of ill-mannered university students also arrive at the resort and demand to use the courts initially reserved for Seishun. Annoyed by their arrogance, Ryouma Echizen single-handedly challenges them to a match, with the winner claiming the right to the courts. Can the young freshman "super rookie" defeat the pompous team by himself?

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Minna Tomodachi
Japanese: みんな友だち
Synopsis: An educational animation on the problems of bullying and friendship.

Title: Present
Japanese: プレゼント
Synopsis: An educational film about bullying. Ayaka gives a hand made picture from to Miyuki for her birthday. Miyuki likes expensive things and starts to hate Ayaka for the shabby gift, going so far as to have the class turn on Ayaka as well. The bullying continues to the point where Ayaka stops comming to school.

Title: Tomoko-chan to Watashi
Japanese: とも子ちゃんとわたし
Synopsis:
A film meant to show how to deal with "lively" children in the classroom. 

While not outwardly stated, Tomoko-chan may have some form of ADD or mild autism or both as most kids her age are lively but Tomoko-chan is more wound up than regular children.

Title: Obake Nagaya
Japanese: おばけ長屋
Synopsis: A comedic tale about a haunted room.

Title: Kaze no Tabibito
Japanese: 風の旅人
Synopsis: An educational film about wheel-chair bound people in Japan.

Title: Anime Koten Bungaku Kan
Japanese: アニメ古典文学館
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Yuukai Boushi Animation Eiga: Akazukin-chan Chanto Check
Japanese: 誘拐防止アニメーション映画 赤ずきんちゃん ちゃんとチェック
Synopsis: A kidnapping safety anime. Teaching children check points of situations where their safety is in danger.

Title: Azarashi Tama-chan no Hi no Youjin
Japanese: アザラシ・タマちゃんの火の用心
Synopsis: An educational fire safety video for kids with a talking transforming seal.

Title: Shippai Ippai mo Ikkai
Japanese: しっぱい・いっぱい・もいっかい
Synopsis: An educational film aimed at lower elementary schoolers about accepting defeat. Sometimes you will fail doing something and that's okay. You need to learn to tolerate the pain you feel in your heart and gain the courage to try again to accomplish your goals.

Title: Okaasan, Nakanaide
Japanese: お母さん、なかないで
Synopsis: An educational anime about the importance of life.

Title: Ano Yama ni Noborou yo
Japanese: あの山に登ろうよ
Synopsis: Three friends find themselves on an adventure to Rainbow Mountain, a magical place where the first rainbow is said to have been created. However, getting to the top of the mountain requires courage and perseverance in the face of many challenges.

Title: Hello Kitty no Kieta Santa-san no Okurimono
Japanese: ハローキティのきえたサンタさんのおくりもの
Synopsis: Kitty and Mimmy are preparing for Santa's visit by making him cookies.

Title: Detective Conan OVA 04: Conan and Kid and Crystal Mother
Japanese: 名探偵コナン コナンとキッドとクリスタルマザー
Synopsis:
Once again, Kaitou Kid has a target in mind: the Crystal Mother, Europe's largest topaz owned by Queen Selizabeth of the Principality of Ingram. He intends to steal this jewel while the Queen is stuck on a train from Tokyo to Osaka. However, Kid's abilities are put to the test, as the Queen has already concealed the gem somewhere aboard the train. 

Conan Edogawa, who is among train's passengers, suspects an attack from the phantom thief and begins investigating on his own, while Inspector Ginzou Nakamori is ready for a new confrontation against the elusive jewelry robber. 

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Tokugawa Iemitsu to Edo Bakufu
Japanese: 徳川家光と江戸幕府
Synopsis: An educational film about Tokugawa Iemitsu. He was the grandson of Tokugawa Ieyasa (who founded the Tokugawa shogunate and ended the Sengoku era with his victory). Iemitsu is mostly known for his xenophobia and tried to close Japan to the world, this is known as Sakoku. The policies he put into place blocked out Japan for nearly 200 years which eventually caused internal strife and internal war in the Meiji era when Japan opened its borders again only to find it was economically, politically, industrially, scientifically, and culturally behind the rest of the world.

Title: Minamoto no Yoritomo to Bushi no Yononaka
Japanese: 源頼朝と武士の世の中
Synopsis: An educational film about Minamoto no Yoritomo. He founded the Kamakura shogunate which reigned from 1192 to 1333.

Title: Mina no Mura no Gomi Soudou
Japanese: ミナの村のごみ騒動
English: Mina's Village Says Yes! to Waste Management
Synopsis:
Mina's family has a baby goat, but it dies from eating a plastic bag left in the paddy field. Some children are absent from school due to health problems caused by waste. So, the villagers have a meeting to discuss what they can do to improve waste management.

(Source: ACCU)

Title: Hajimete no Eigo: Nippon Mukashibanashi
Japanese: 初めてのえいご・日本昔ばなし
Synopsis: Old Japanese folk legends released on Japanese and English to teach Japanese children English.

Title: Ring ni Kakero 1 Pilot
Japanese: リングにかけろ１ パイロットフィルム
Synopsis: A collection of short sequences taken from the Ring no Kakero manga, made during the production of the fifth Saint Seiya movie by the same team.

Title: Tegami
Japanese: 手紙
Synopsis: A young boy lives with his grandfather who survived WW2. When a letter comes in the main, the grandfather begins to weeps. He then tells his grandson the story of about this letter his friend wrote.

Title: Goannai Shimasu Another World e
Japanese: ご案内します アナザーワールドへ
Synopsis: Part of the series of educational videos that teaches kids and young adults several basic tax lessons.

Title: Yasashii Ookami
Japanese: やさしいオオカミ
Synopsis: Bullying was what kept a timid wolf from showing kindness, but what was the real strength he showed?

Title: Hana to Kaze no Fantasy
Japanese: 花と風のファンタジー
Synopsis:
Introducing the world of fairies that you can relax and enjoy.

40 carefully selected works from Moe Nagata's works
It starts to move to the gentle music. .
Also includes a special edition, an interview with Moe Nagata.

(Source: Official Facebook, edited)

Title: Meiji Ishin wo Tsukuriageta Hitobito
Japanese: 明治維新をつくりあげた人々
Synopsis: An educational film about Yukichi Fukuzawa who helped head the Meiji Restoration after Japan's 200 year isolation.

Title: Hibike! Wadaiko
Japanese: ひびけ! 和だいこ
Synopsis: An educational film about the Convention on the Rights of the Child in Japan. In the movie's example, a group of children are practicing taiko (drums) for a recital at the community center. Local adult residents force them to stop, saying that it's selfish for kids to disturb their peace. Their teacher tells them about the Convention on the Rights of the Child so they have the courage to stand up to the the adults to dispel the ideology of "kids don't know anything. They need to shut up and do what we tell them."

Title: Yooidon!
Japanese: よーいドン！
Synopsis: An educational film about teamwork in Japan. In the movie's example, a group of kids training for a 3-legged style race but with their entire class. Personalities and physical fitness clash.

Title: Itsumo Kokoro ni Hohoemi wo
Japanese: いつもこころにほほえみを
Synopsis: An educational anime that portrays disabled people, life, and human rights.

Title: Tabidachi no Hi ni
Japanese: 旅立ちの日に
Synopsis: An educational film about family issues surrounding a wedding. Typical wedding tropes seen in various media are displayed realistically here. Such as the lack of respect a mother-in-law gives her soon to be daughter-in-law, monetary stress between the two families, stereotyping the other family and thinking poorly of them, and other self-centered ideas.

Title: Yot-chan no Fushigina Crayon
Japanese: よっちゃんの不思議なクレヨン
Synopsis: A little girl receives magic crayons from her Grandma that brings to life anything she draws.

Title: Tenka wo Mezashita Sannin no Bushou
Japanese: 天下をめざした３人の武将
Synopsis: An educational anime about the 3 major warlords in the Sengoku era. Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, and Tokugawa Ieyasu.

Title: Hana to Shounen
Japanese: 花と少年
Synopsis: Yuji and Koichi set off on a journey to find a rare bamboo flower for a school project. In the forest they encounter a legendary phoenix who asks for their help to save the forest.

Title: Son Gokuu no Koutsuu Rule Shugyou Chuu
Japanese: 孫悟空の交通ルール修行中
Synopsis: An educational film about traffic safety staring the Saiyuuki cast.

Title: Mirai e no Niji: Boku no Ojisan wa, Hansen-byou
Japanese: 未来への虹 -僕のおじさんは, ハンセン病-
Synopsis: An educational film out leprosy. As of 2009, there are 2,600 people with leprosy in Japan--all of whom are living in sanatoriums and hospitals. The story follows two kids going to visit their uncle who lives in a sanatorium.

Title: Kokoro no Catchball
Japanese: 心のキャッチボール
Synopsis: An educational anime about the importance of having a connection to the community.

Title: Manabu no Natsuyasumi
Japanese: 学の夏休み
Synopsis:
Released by JCI (Junior Chamber International) Japan to promote self awareness and appreciation of "Japan's soul".

Manubu's mother leaves him with his uncle, grandmother and niece Kiyomi to spend his summer vacation.
Him being a real city brat he has no real appreciation for nature and the outdoors and the values of life. He will soon learn differently...

(Source: AniDB)

Title: Jin Ken Mamoru-kun to Ayumi-chan Sekai wo Shiawase ni
Japanese: 人KENまもる君とあゆみちゃん 世界をしあわせに
Synopsis: Character designs by Takashi Yanase, creator of Anpanman, this official Ministry of Justice commissioned anime teachers children about how to peruse happiness for themselves and others through truth.

Title: Jigoku no Soubee
Japanese: じごくのそうべえ
Synopsis:
Based on a picture book of the same name.

Four people that died have to use their special skills in order to get out of hell and into paradise.

Title: Gomen ne, Mii-chan
Japanese: ごめんね, ミーちゃん
Synopsis: An educational film about children's animal cruelty in Japan.

Title: Kaneko Misuzu: Yasashisa no Fuukei
Japanese: 金子みすゞ やさしさの風景
Synopsis: Poetry of Kaneko Misuzu read while descriptive animations play in the background.

Title: Kizu-darake no Ringo
Japanese: きずらだけのりんご
Synopsis: Genta is a tanuki who befriends a human girl in his human form. Every day is fun when he's able to lie. But one day his lie puts the girl in danger and Genta has to make a choice.

Title: Goi-sensei to Tarou
Japanese: 五井先生と太郎
Synopsis: Tarou is the only student in the class that Goi-sensei uses an honorific for. This extremely bothers Tarou as he's the only Tarou in the class and it is unneeded. Over winter break Goi-sensei is hospitalized and Tarou goes to visit him and hears the story of why he uses an honorific for Tarou.

Title: Detective Conan OVA 05: The Target is Kogoro! The Detective Boys' Secret Investigation
Japanese: 名探偵コナン 標的は小五郎!!少年探偵団マル秘調査
Synopsis:
Conan Edogawa and his classmates are assigned to do a class report about a small business of their choice. After discarding other possible topics, the Detective Boys concludes that it's a perfect opportunity to find out more about  Detective Kogorou Mouri's job.

Conan's friends refuse to settle for a simple interview though, as they want to experience first-hand all the details of his work. Thus, they, along with a reluctant Conan and Ai Haibara, decide to tail the renowned detective for a day. However, the kids soon get involved in a grim situation when Kogorou's current case takes an unexpected and dangerous turn.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Title: Karugamo Oyako no Hi no Youjin
Japanese: カルガモ親子の火の用心
Synopsis: An educational fire safety video for kids with an imaginative spin of a fire brigade made of talking ducks.

Title: Nendjuugyouji Animation Series
Japanese: 年中行事アニメーションシリーズ
Synopsis: An animation teaching tool meant to explain how holidays were created and why we celebrate them. Such as why red carnations are used for Mother's Day or koinobori are used for Children's Day.

Title: Kono Sora no Shita de
Japanese: この空の下で
Synopsis: An educational film about social town development in Japan.

Title: Onita no Boushi
Japanese: おにたのぼうし
Synopsis: The Oni child, Onita was edged out from the house he used to live on the day taking with him a hat. The outside was so cold and dark, he looked for another house but humans put hiiragi iwashi (holly and sardine head talismans) on house entrances to keep demons away and he could not get in. However, there was only one house without this talisman and without throwing the roasted soybeans. In this house, a girl and sick mother lived together. The girl kept vigil beside her mother’s bed all days and did not have enough time and money to eat meal, not to mention throwing roasted soybeans. Realizing the predicament they were in, Onita found meal from somewhere. Disguising as a man, he offered the meal he got to the girl, saying that he made too much for Setsubun. The meals he offered were sekihan and green bean dish. He then leaves to find a new place to live, leaving only his hat behind.

Title: Momoiro no Crayon
Japanese: 桃色のクレヨン
Synopsis: An educational film about the abuse done upon intellectually disabled children.

Title: Konjiki no Gash Bell!!: Hashire Gash!! Ubawareta Umagon
Japanese: 金色のガッシュベル！！走れガッシュ！！奪われたウマゴン
Synopsis: An old acquaintance of Gash's has kidnapped Umagon in revenge for his arrest. Can Gash rescue Umagon?

Title: Nagareboshi no Okurimono
Japanese: 流れ星のおくりもの
Synopsis: Unknown

Title: Jishin da!! Mii-chan no Bousai Kunren
Japanese: じしんだ!! ミーちゃんのぼうさいくんれん
Synopsis: An educational disaster safety video for kids featuring Mii-chan the cat and Daiki-kun after their animal abuse issue from the previous educational short.

Title: Animation!
Japanese: Animation!
Synopsis:
A collection of short animations, from the revelations Tomoyoshi Joko and Hiroco Ichinose.

By Tomoyoshi Joko
AFRO - 2006 (1:30)
Kumo no Hito Ame no Hito (Mr. Cloud and Mr. Rain) - 2007 (6:35)
Buildings - 2008 (5:44)
Lizard Planet - 2009 (5:00)
Kanagawa Dog - 2009 (00:20)

By Hiroco Ichinose
annihilation - 2005 (00:12)
The last breakfast - 2006 (2:28)
Ushi Nichi (Cow's Day) - 2007 (9:29)
ha-P - 2008 (4:14)
COSMIC! (pilot film) - 2009 (3:20)
YOKOHA-MAMAN -2009 (00:20)
morning (pilot film) - 2009 (1:30)

Joint
Buil-Bun - 2006 (1:30)
Genres: Adventure, Avant Garde, Comedy, Fantasy, Mystery

Title: Minna Ichiban!
Japanese: みんないちばん！
Synopsis: An educational film about seeing the best in people.

Title: Anime Tengu no Kakuresato
Japanese: アニメ 天狗のかくれ里
Synopsis: An educational anime targeting environmental problems (such as the feral boar population in Japan) with a twist as two children become involved with the tengu that live in the mountains.

Title: Detective Conan: Anti-Crime Guide
Japanese: 名探偵コナン 防犯ガイド
Synopsis: A Meitantei Conan education anime aimed at children. It's an anti-crime guide that teaches children how they should react in different scenarios through a question-answer format. An accompanying book was also created to compliment the anime.

Title: Himawari no You ni
Japanese: ひまわりのように
Synopsis: An educational film about family support for job loss and mental illness in Japan.

Title: Ijimekko Ookami to Nana-chan
Japanese: いじめっこ狼とナナちゃん
Synopsis: An educational animation on the problems of bullying told through the the fable of "The Wolf and the Seven Young Goats."

Title: The Collected Animations of ICAF (2001-2006)
Japanese: Inter College Animation Festival (2004) (インターカレッジ・アニメーション・フェスティバル)
Synopsis: A collection of the best entries shown at the annual Inter-College Animation Festival from 2001 to 2006. For many animation students in Japan participating in the festival is a chance to start their professional careers. The entries include works made using various animation techniques, including CGI and stop-motion. Taku Furukawa, Katayama Masahiro and Kihune Tokumitsu can be found among the judges of the festival.

Title: Namae... Sore wa Moeru Inochi
Japanese: 名前... それは燃えるいのち
Synopsis: An educational film about accepting another's ethnicity and cultural background in Japan.

Title: Kiminari Dousuru? Yuukai Itazura: Sarenai Tame ni
Japanese: きみならどうする？ゆうかい・いたずら されないために
Synopsis: An educational film meant to teach children how to avoid being kidnapped.

Title: Anime de Tanoshiku Manabu Koutsuu Anzen: Tenshi no Kotencotenco
Japanese: アニメで 楽しく学ぶ交通安全 天使のこてんこてんこ
Synopsis: A traffic safety film starring the cast of Kotencotenco.

Title: Yume no Tsuzuki
Japanese: 夢のつづき
Synopsis: An educational film about the alienation of the elderly in Japan.

Title: Coluboccoro
Japanese: コルボッコロ
Synopsis:
